LABEL: 0x25F
STRING: 「――Well then.」

LABEL: 0x279
STRING: 「We need to get a grasp on our current situation.」

LABEL: 0x29C
STRING: Tokiwa started talking.

LABEL: 0x2BC
STRING: We returned to the wheelhouse and decided to look for the best way forward based on the information we had.

LABEL: 0x376
STRING: 「A lost "best path" means nothing.」

LABEL: 0x3AE
STRING: 「It's not a good idea to continue reaching for it...」

LABEL: 0x3E8
STRING: 「What we need to do is search for the "next best plan" on a zero-based basis.」

LABEL: 0x44C
STRING: 「The plan we obtain by doing so is the best path we can choose in our current situation.」

LABEL: 0x49A
STRING: 「An impossible ideal is nothing more than a reference.」

LABEL: 0x4DE
STRING: 「It's a limiting factor in our thinking, so we should eliminate it.」

LABEL: 0x52D
STRING: Keep looking for the best path for the present situation.

LABEL: 0x561
STRING: It was the most basic of basics, but that was exactly why it was right.

LABEL: 0x59D
STRING: We had to think like that because there was not much time left.

LABEL: 0x64D
STRING: 「Our goal is to escape from here.」

LABEL: 0x689
STRING: 「The only way to do that would be to wait for rescue, or to leave the <SHEEP III> on our own in some way...」

LABEL: 0x6EB
STRING: 「We can't wait around for rescue.」

LABEL: 0x725
STRING: 「The power for the heating will run out soon, and the temperature on the ship will drop drastically.」

LABEL: 0x775
STRING: 「It's not that we'll die the moment the power runs out, but it's safe to say that's our time limit.」

LABEL: 0x7F8
STRING: 「――I see. That would be bad.」

LABEL: 0x849
STRING: Tokiwa turned around and went to a control panel of a computer she'd just turned on.

LABEL: 0x8A1
STRING: In no time at all, the display showed the heating settings.

LABEL: 0x951
STRING: 「Indeed, it seems that the remaining power has decreased considerably.」

LABEL: 0x98B
STRING: 「How long will it last...?」

LABEL: 0x9B4
STRING: 「Hey, can't you do something about it?」

LABEL: 0x9FF
STRING: 「I'm not a carpenter.」

LABEL: 0xA34
STRING: 「I guess... Sorry for asking.」

LABEL: 0xA68
STRING: ...That was a bad habit of mine.

LABEL: 0xA88
STRING: She was a genius, so I always tried to leave everything to her.

LABEL: 0xADE
STRING: I would be no better than the people of ROMLES who had been taking advantage of her if I did that.

LABEL: 0xB2A
STRING: 「In other words, it's too late to wait for rescue.」

LABEL: 0xB5C
STRING: 「Even if we can get in touch with them, we can't wait that long.」

LABEL: 0xC1A
STRING: 「So, the only option left to us is to escape on our own.」

LABEL: 0xCA7
STRING: 「I'm tired of waiting.」

LABEL: 0xCDC
STRING: Tokiwa said it all without hesitation.

LABEL: 0xD04
STRING: Certainly, there was no point in waiting, so we had no choice but to escape.

LABEL: 0xD48
STRING: Once we decided to do so, we could narrow the course of our thinking.

LABEL: 0xDF0
STRING: 「Now that we've decided on a course of action...」

LABEL: 0xE22
STRING: 「What means do we have to escape?」

LABEL: 0xE5F
STRING: 「Wait a minute.」

LABEL: 0xE7B
STRING: 「Let's think logically.」

LABEL: 0xE9D
STRING: Monitors were spread over one side of the wheelhouse.

LABEL: 0xECD
STRING: I turned my head while looking at the parameters of the gauges displayed on each of them.

LABEL: 0xF1B
STRING: 「We're approximately 700 meters deep...」

LABEL: 0xFAD
STRING: 「It's impossible to go outside without pressure-resistant equipment.」

LABEL: 0xFF2
STRING: Impossible to go outside...

LABEL: 0x1010
STRING: It was only natural, but that was because we didn't have pressure-resistant equipment.

LABEL: 0x104E
STRING: Pressure-resistant... <SHEEP III>...

LABEL: 0x1077
STRING: 「...What about raising the whole ship?」

LABEL: 0x1115
STRING: 「――Let's think about it.」

LABEL: 0x1140
STRING: I thought it was a ridiculous idea, but――

LABEL: 0x1182
STRING: Nevertheless, Tokiwa didn't say that it was impossible.

LABEL: 0x11B8
STRING: Did that mean there was room to think?

LABEL: 0x120F
STRING: 「Heigh-ho.」

LABEL: 0x122E
STRING: She pulled out a terminal out of nowhere.

LABEL: 0x126E
STRING: It was the tablet from the library...

LABEL: 0x12A2
STRING: Come to think of it, she had that before as well, but I didn't realize she still did.

LABEL: 0x1356
STRING: 「This is information from the library.」

LABEL: 0x1400
STRING: 「What is it, Tokiwa?」

LABEL: 0x1490
STRING: 「Sorry, but can I ask you to enter some numbers exactly as I tell you?」

LABEL: 0x14E8
STRING: 「I'm busy doing the calculations, so...」

LABEL: 0x1511
STRING: Blueprints for the ship were displayed on the tablet.

LABEL: 0x1543
STRING: Tokiwa glanced over them for a moment, then looked up and started calculating the density.

LABEL: 0x159E
STRING: 「...Assuming that the third and second floors in the rear section have been filled with water, the mass is about――」

LABEL: 0x15F4
STRING: 「Katagiri-san, what are the values?」

LABEL: 0x162D
STRING: 「Let me see...」

LABEL: 0x164B
STRING: She proceeded with her calculations one after another.

LABEL: 0x1677
STRING: Tokiwa, facing the ceiling, recited the formulas, and I typed each one out to get a value.

LABEL: 0x16D1
STRING: Eventually――

LABEL: 0x1755
STRING: 「――We've reached a result.」

LABEL: 0x177E
STRING: It was an obvious number, even to me.

LABEL: 0x17B6
STRING: In the first place, the <SHEEP III> had ballast tanks installed around the bridges,

LABEL: Split3
STRING: the areas where the two pressure-resistant hulls were joined, and at the outer lower parts of the hulls.

LABEL: 0x1859
STRING: Ballast was, in essence, a weight... A mechanism that controlled a submarine's ascent.

LABEL: 0x18A9
STRING: The <SHEEP III> adjusted its ascent and descent by moving seawater in and out of its ballast tanks.

LABEL: 0x1920
STRING: Right now, all the ballast tanks were filled with seawater.

LABEL: 0x1960
STRING: It was already confirmed immediately after the accident that the ballast tanks couldn't be drained.

LABEL: 0x19B0
STRING: But, even if all the seawater was to be drained and replaced with air...

LABEL: 0x1A20
STRING: 「――We're 300 tons short.」

LABEL: 0x1A45
STRING: It was due to the first and second floors of the rear section, that had originally contributed to the buoyancy of the ship.

LABEL: 0x1A87
STRING: They were now filled with seawater and had become a weight, so to speak.

LABEL: 0x1AE7
STRING: With that in mind,

LABEL: 0x1B09
STRING: the cargo this ship had to throw out was 300 tons.

LABEL: 0x1B3A
STRING: ――It wasn't realistic at all.

LABEL: 0x1B64
STRING: 「...That's within expectations.」

LABEL: 0x1B88
STRING: 「There's nothing to be disappointed about.」

LABEL: 0x1C1C
STRING: 「Yes.」

LABEL: 0x1C32
STRING: 「No matter how obvious it may seem, we need to eliminate possibilities one by one.」

LABEL: 0x1CD9
STRING: 「That's the basics of science.」

LABEL: 0x1D06
STRING: Right now, we didn't even have the time to be disappointed.

LABEL: 0x1D36
STRING: If you had time for that, use it to think of as many possibilities as possible instead.

LABEL: 0x1D82
STRING: What we needed to consider next was――

LABEL: 0x1DA6
STRING: 「...The rescue ship.」

LABEL: 0x1E30
STRING: 「That's it.」

LABEL: 0x1E4F
STRING: The rescue ship was connected to the emergency room.

LABEL: 0x1E77
STRING: It was a place I had visited with Tokiwa earlier――

LABEL: 0x1FD5
STRING: I forced whatever was rising up my esophagus back down.

LABEL: 0x200B
STRING: That monstrous image of the girl who'd been alive until yesterday was burned into my mind.

LABEL: 0x205D
STRING: ――Don't lose focus.

LABEL: 0x207D
STRING: Escaping from the <SHEEP III> was what mattered...

LABEL: 0x20AA
STRING: To that end, let's just think about how that rescue ship could be useful.

LABEL: 0x21ED
STRING: 「If the ship has been destroyed to that extent, then...」

LABEL: 0x2240
STRING: 「I don't think it'll be possible to repair it even if we both worked together.」

LABEL: 0x228D
STRING: Tokiwa clearly stated that it was "impossible."

LABEL: 0x22BD
STRING: With that, the possibility of us using the rescue ship was gone, huh...?

LABEL: 0x2367
STRING: 「However,

LABEL: 0x237F
STRING: I just thought of it now, but...」

LABEL: 0x23B0
STRING: She had noticed something.

LABEL: 0x23D2
STRING: That was often the key to a solution.

LABEL: 0x240A
STRING: Even if that wasn't the case, we had to examine every possibility that came to our minds.

LABEL: 0x2448
STRING: One by one, from first to last.

LABEL: 0x2477
STRING: 「Is it necessary to repair the ship in the first place?」

LABEL: 0x24D0
STRING: 「...What do you mean?」

LABEL: 0x2503
STRING: 「That ship is much simpler than the <SHEEP III>.」

LABEL: 0x2559
STRING: 「Yeah. It's apparently an older submarine that was repurposed.」

LABEL: 0x2597
STRING: 「From what I could tell, it looked about ten years old...」

LABEL: 0x25C7
STRING: A rescue ship using a decommissioned submarine――

LABEL: 0x25F9
STRING: Yukari was the one who had told me about it.

LABEL: 0x2629
STRING: 「So, what about it?」

LABEL: 0x26BF
STRING: 「The model of the ship may not matter much.」

LABEL: 0x26F3
STRING: 「I was more interested in its size.」

LABEL: 0x273E
STRING: 「The... size?」

LABEL: 0x276F
STRING: 「As far as I'm concerned, a submersible of that size...」

LABEL: 0x27B7
STRING: 「I'm sure that it has many aspects that are fundamentally different from those of the <SHEEP III>.」

LABEL: 0x280C
STRING: 「There might be a clue there.」

LABEL: 0x2845
STRING: Hmmm...

LABEL: 0x28CB
STRING: 「...No good.」

LABEL: 0x28EB
STRING: 「As you can imagine, we don't have the specifications for the rescue ship here.」

LABEL: 0x2930
STRING: She swiped her tablet and struck a hopeless pose.

LABEL: 0x2979
STRING: 「We may be able to get that information if we return to the library.」

LABEL: 0x29C2
STRING: 「But I don't have Yukari's dongle anymore.」

LABEL: 0x2A09
STRING: 「Now that I think about it, yes...」

LABEL: 0x2A36
STRING: We shouldn't get carried away here.

LABEL: 0x2A52
STRING: Let's put the rescue ship aside for now.

LABEL: 0x2A82
STRING: 「Are there any other leads――」

LABEL: 0x2B18
STRING: 「...The deep sea.」

LABEL: 0x2B32
STRING: 「...You've been outside the ship twice.」

LABEL: 0x2B70
STRING: 「Did you find anything that might be a lead there?」

LABEL: 0x2BA9
STRING: 「...Well, umm...」

LABEL: 0x2BC7
STRING: The first time was when I had gone to rescue Reiri.

LABEL: 0x2BF9
STRING: The window of the rear section had been severely damaged, and seawater had flowed in from there.

LABEL: 0x2C3F
STRING: Was there anything we could use in that scene...?

LABEL: 0x2C7D
STRING: 「That's right, that broken probe unit!」

LABEL: 0x2D1B
STRING: 「How will that help us?」

LABEL: 0x2D44
STRING: 「...Even if we fix it, we won't be able to use it.」

LABEL: 0x2D8E
STRING: Thinking back on it now, that destroyed probe unit must have been done in by a shark or something.

LABEL: 0x2DE2
STRING: Yesterday, when I dove to the bottom of the sea in response to her request, I saw a shark with rows of sharp teeth.

LABEL: 0x2EA4
STRING: ――It was later holding Hikari's corpse in its mouth.

LABEL: 0x2EDA
STRING: In the end, I couldn't save her either...

LABEL: 0x2F12
STRING: ...No, just focus on how to escape for now.

LABEL: 0x2FA5
STRING: That's right, what did I see in the water yesterday?

LABEL: 0x2FCF
STRING: Was there anything of use?

LABEL: 0x2FFF
STRING: Thinking back on it, there were a number of strange things.

LABEL: 0x3037
STRING: A strange, hose-like thing with bubbles spewing out of it.

LABEL: 0x3075
STRING: A number of mysterious metal plates lay at the bottom of the sea.

LABEL: 0x30AB
STRING: It was only now that I thought about them.

LABEL: 0x30DB
STRING: Was that the wreckage of a once-sunken ship or something?

LABEL: 0x3115
STRING: There were not any other parts there, however...

LABEL: 0x3269
STRING: 「What are you thinking?」

LABEL: 0x3294
STRING: 「Actually, when I was exploring the seafloor yesterday...」

LABEL: 0x32E0
STRING: I tried to remember everything that had happened and told her.

LABEL: 0x338A
STRING: 「A pipe with air bubbles coming out of it...」

LABEL: 0x33AC
STRING: 「Mysterious plates...」

LABEL: 0x33CA
STRING: 「Hmm-hmm.」

LABEL: 0x33E2
STRING: 「I seem to recall something about bubbles...」

LABEL: 0x342F
STRING: 「How about the plates?」

LABEL: 0x34C1
STRING: 「I've never seen such a deep-sea creature before...」

LABEL: 0x3500
STRING: 「No, they were clearly man-made. Several of them were the same shape.」

LABEL: 0x3561
STRING: 「Disc-shaped iron plates, you say?」

LABEL: 0x3587
STRING: 「Who would carry such an artificial object, and for what purpose?」

LABEL: 0x35C5
STRING: 「Only submarines come to the bottom of the sea like this...」

LABEL: 0x360E
STRING: 「...A submarine.」

LABEL: 0x362A
STRING: 「A submarine left them behind...」

LABEL: 0x3670
STRING: ――At that moment, something Yukari had told me crossed my mind.

LABEL: 0x37E3
STRING: 「――Seven years ago, on the 1st of August.」

LABEL: 0x3809
STRING: 「The three of us dove into this dark bay.」

LABEL: 0x389C
STRING: I had once asked my sister a question.

LABEL: 0x38F5
STRING: 「Of course, what we used at the time was a smaller submarine.」

LABEL: 0x399A
STRING: I wondered what she would do if trouble broke out in the deep sea and she could no longer surface.

LABEL: 0x3A15
STRING: 「It was an old-fashioned and compact ship, with windows that condensated quickly and which used detachable steel plate weights in order to float.」

LABEL: 0x3A73
STRING: My sister had answered...

LABEL: 0x3B7A
STRING: "All you have to do is cut off the weights."

LABEL: 0x3CA7
STRING: 「――The ballast!」

LABEL: 0x3CC9
STRING: 「Those must be the ballast weights of a submarine that once came here!」

LABEL: 0x3D1F
STRING: The missing pieces had all come together...

LABEL: 0x3DD7
STRING: 「I see. So there's no need for a small submarine to adjust its buoyancy with a ballast tank.」

LABEL: 0x3E3B
STRING: 「In other words, when it sinks, it simply carries weights made of iron or something, and on the way back, it floats by dumping them underwater...」

LABEL: 0x3EB8
STRING: 「That's how deep-sea submarines were originally designed.」

LABEL: 0x3EFA
STRING: On a scale as large as the <SHEEP III>, it was more efficient to consolidate the weights into ballast tanks.

LABEL: 0x3F7F
STRING: That, and the <SHEEP III> was a ship that needed to stay underwater.

LABEL: 0x3FC0
STRING: However, for a normal deep-sea submarine, it was fine as long as it sank to the bottom.

LABEL: 0x400A
STRING: If this was the case, it was natural that ballast tanks would be used only for auxiliary purposes, and weights would be used mainly for floating and sinking.

LABEL: 0x40DA
STRING: 「If so, then maybe the rescue ship also uses them...」

LABEL: 0x410F
STRING: If Yukari was correct, the rescue ship was a repurposed older submarine.

LABEL: 0x416B
STRING: Which meant that the likelihood it used simple ballast was high.

LABEL: 0x41AD
STRING: 「...It's entirely possible.」

LABEL: 0x4241
STRING: 「Can they be detached from the outside?」

LABEL: 0x4276
STRING: 「I don't know...」

LABEL: 0x4296
STRING: 「But, if we can remove the weights without using the computer...」

LABEL: 0x42F0
STRING: 「...There's air inside the ship.」

LABEL: 0x4318
STRING: 「――It's possible to surface.」

LABEL: 0x433A
STRING: We saw a single possibility.

LABEL: 0x43CC
STRING: 「We should try it.」

LABEL: 0x43F3
STRING: 「――Let's take another look at the rescue ship.」

LABEL: 0x443F
STRING: I hurried to stand up.

LABEL: 0x44CB
STRING: Even the short distance to the emergency room felt frustrating.

LABEL: 0x4505
STRING: Although we weren't being chased by anyone, my pace naturally quickened.

LABEL: 0x454D
STRING: And so, we arrived at the emergency room and opened the door――

LABEL: 0x45EA
STRING: ――Inside...

LABEL: 0x4606
STRING: An unexpected scene unfolded before me.
